intro.title: Photography
intro.text: This is a bit of an experiment. I uploaded around 600 of my photos, and asked an AI (LLM) to score them against different categories. Click any category to see the full album. The button below shows the full gallery of photographs.

categories.name: Featured
categories.description: These are the ones the AI thinks are my "best." What do you think? Perhaps I should make a section of the ones I like, for comparison.

categories.name: People
categories.description: Portraits and candid moments with people as the main subject.

categories.name: Pets
categories.description: Cats, dogs, and other beloved companion animals. Looks like the AI also included a few raccoons, etc. I guess I like those too!

categories.name: Wildlife
categories.description: Animals in their natural habitats. The AI does pretty well here.

categories.name: Landscape
categories.description: Mountains, forests, beaches, and natural scenery. Also wants to include a bunch of animals, so I'm working to exlude those.

categories.name: Urban
categories.description: City streets, buildings, architecture, and urban environments.

categories.name: Vehicles
categories.description: Cars, trucks, trains, and other modes of transportation.

categories.name: Food
categories.description: Culinary creations and food photography. I don't think I actually do much food photography, so the AI's probably correct not to put too many in here.

categories.name: Macro
categories.description: Extreme close-ups revealing intricate details. The AI really struggles here. It really doesn't seem to understand what's meant by "macro" photography.

categories.name: Odds & Ends
categories.description: Images that don't fit neatly into other categories. The ones the AI didn't score highly against any prompt. A lot of these are people -- the AI seems to have trouble reliably identifying shots of people.
